alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Lunenburg (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 7:01PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Lunenburg and central Brunswick Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 701 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Dundas, or 7 miles southeast of Kenbridge, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea sized hail, and very heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lawrenceville, Alberta, Dundas, Bacons Fork, Cochran, Gills Corner, Dolphin, Barrows Store, Meredithville, Danieltown, Callaville, Edgerton and Prices Mill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
